variable.name: CTFLAG
variable.comment: Indicates if a participant has been randomized to one or more of the Clinical Trial components (HRT, CAD, DM).

variable.name: OSFLAG
variable.comment: Indicates if a participant has been enrolled into the Observational Study.

variable.name: HRTFLAG
variable.comment: Indicates if a participant has been randomized to the Hormone Replacement Therapy Trial.

variable.name: DMFLAG
variable.comment: Indicates if a participant has been randomized to the Dietary Modification Trial.

variable.name: CADFLAG
variable.comment: Indicates if a participant has been randomized to the Calcium and Vitamin D Trial.

variable.name: HRTARM
variable.comment: Hormone Replacement Therapy study arm to which the participant was randomized

variable.name: DMARM
variable.comment: Dietary Modification study arm to which the participant was randomized

variable.name: CADARM
variable.comment: Calcium and vitamin D study arm to which the participant was randomized

variable.name: CADDAYS
variable.description: Days since CT randomization to CaD randomization

variable.name: BMDFLAG
variable.comment: Indicates if the participant was randomized or enrolled at a bone density clinic and was not randomized or enrolled as a part of enhanced recruitment for that clinic.

variable.name: AGESTRAT
variable.description: Age stratum at randomization or enrollment
variable.comment: Based on the birth date reported by the participant at the time of randomization or enrollment. Categorization of the Age at Screening variable may differ due to participants requesting a correction to their Form 2 birth date after randomization.

variable.name: REGION
variable.comment: Residence at the time of randomization or enrollment. Four categories based on US Census definition.

variable.name: LATREGION
variable.description: Latitude (degrees N) of CC at CT randomization/OS enrollment
variable.comment: Region of residence at the time of randomization or enrollment, based on the latitude of the responsible clinical center.

variable.name: WATTSCAT
variable.description: Watts ((J/s) per m2) of CC at CT randomization/OS enrollment
variable.comment: The WATT is a unit of solar irradiance and measures the daily UVB flux reaching the earth, within the wavelength range necessary for vitamin D synthesis. The information is in: Lubin D, Jensen EH, Gies HP. Global surface ultraviolet radiation climatology from TOMS and ERBE data. Journal of Geophysical Research 1998;103 (D20):26061-26091. Categories are based on the WATTs of the clinical center at the time of randomization or enrollment.

variable.name: LANGLEYSCAT
variable.description: Langleys (g-cal per cm2) of CC at CT randomization/OS enrollment
variable.comment: The Langley is a unit of solar irradiance and relates to the amount that reaches a given area of the earth's surface. The information is from national weather data on total solar irradiance in the United States and is adapted from Garland and Garland (Do sunlight and vitamin D reduce the likelihood of colon cancer? Int J Epidemiol 1980;9:227-31.) Categories are based on the Langleys of the clinical center at the time of randomization or enrollment.

variable.name: LATREGIONCAD
variable.description: Latitude (degrees N) of CC at CaD randomization
variable.comment: Region of residence at the time of CaD trial randomization, based on the latitude of the responsible clinical center.

variable.name: WATTSCATCAD
variable.description: Watts ((J/s) per m2) of CC at CaD randomization
variable.comment: The WATT is a unit of solar irradiance and measures the daily UVB flux reaching the earth, within the wavelength range necessary for vitamin D synthesis. The information is in: Lubin D, Jensen EH, Gies HP. Global surface ultraviolet radiation climatology from TOMS and ERBE data. Journal of Geophysical Research 1998;103 (D20):26061-26091. Categories are based on the WATTs of the clinical center at the time of CaD trial randomization.

variable.name: LANGLEYSCATCAD
variable.description: Langleys (g-cal per cm2) of CC at CaD randomization
variable.comment: The Langley is a unit of solar irradiance and relates to the amount that reaches a given area of the earth's surface. The information is from national weather data on total solar irradiance in the United States and is adapted from Garland and Garland (Do sunlight and vitamin D reduce the likelihood of colon cancer? Int J Epidemiol 1980;9:227-31.) Categories are based on the Langleys of the clinical center at the time of CaD trial randomization.
